WorkItem.Description:
In Wolfpack.Core.Checks.CpuCheck.cs,  
```
counter.NextSample();
```
throws the exception when there are multiple instances of a process running.

You may find these useful when fixing the problem:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11885832/can-the-performance-counter-instance-name-of-a-process-change-even-if-the-proces
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5832709/exception-instance-name-of-instance-does-not-exist-in-the-specified-category
WorkItem.Summary: CpuCheck occasionally throws an "Instance does not exist in the specified Category" exception

Comments.Message:
OK thanks for bringing this to my attention - those articles are very useful too!

I'll get a fix in the next release (working on it now).

Thanks,
James
